titleStmt.title: B. F. McCarty et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10600

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
June 19.1861
To the Hon. B Magoffin
Governor of the State of Kentucky:
The undersigned respectfully solicit a release of the fine of $200 imposed upon Joseph Blackwell of South Covington at the present sitting of the Kenton Circuit Court.

B. F. McCarty
Henry Horthman
Martin Huller
Alexander Mulirlee
John Horstman
John McCollum
Jacob Schikner
T. Goolden
J. M. White
Wm T Waterman
John Cheeseman
Robert Waterman
John Flood
Bluless Cremin
Timothy Deleny
P. Cooney
James Cooeny
Fulis Cleark
John Sullivan
Frank Lipphardt
Aled A McGriger
J L Booth
George D,, T,, Porter
Joseph Dupler
James Callagham
James Taylor Sen
Thomas Feinlay
William. C. Taylor
James Taylor Jun
James H Heven
Thomas Manuel
John R Lindley
James Lindley
Robert Taylor
L,, H,, Porter
E. Moore
Joseph Martin
Fillis Marshall
